title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a simple access control system for a secure building:
1. Create variables: isEmployee (boolean), hasKeycard (boolean), securityLevel (number 1-3)
2. Access is granted if:
   - Person is an employee AND has a keycard
   - OR security level is 3 (admin access)
3. Display 'Access Granted' or 'Access Denied'
instructions:
Create a simple access control system for a secure building:
1. Create variables: isEmployee (boolean), hasKeycard (boolean), securityLevel (number 1-3)
2. Access is granted if:
   - Person is an employee AND has a keycard
   - OR security level is 3 (admin access)
3. Display 'Access Granted' or 'Access Denied'

testCases.description: Grants access for employee with keycard

hints.text: Use parentheses to group: if ((isEmployee && hasKeycard) || securityLevel === 3)

commonMistakes.consequence: if (age > 18 and hasLicense) causes a syntax error.
commonMistakes.correction: Use && for AND and || for OR: if (age > 18 && hasLicense)

commonMistakes.consequence: Using || when you need && (or vice versa) gives wrong results.
commonMistakes.correction: Read it aloud: && means BOTH must be true, || means EITHER can be true.

commonMistakes.consequence: Operator precedence may evaluate differently than expected.
commonMistakes.correction: Use parentheses to make grouping explicit: ((a && b) || c)
